data.title: Excellent lunch spot while visitiing the Currier Art museum!
data.text: Had lunch there while visiting the Currier Art museum.  We were impressed that the prices were very reasonable-- I was expecting them to be "captive audience" high priced, and they weren't.  They have a nioce selection of salads and soups-- I found the southwest cauliflower salad to be really good, with a "just right" spicy kick.  My comapnions had ewually nice things to say about their lunches, too.

data.title: Wonderful little restaurant in the middle of the Currier Museum!
data.text: It was a pleasant surprise to find this light-filled cafe during our visit.  The food was very contemporary and quite deliious!  Priced well too!

data.title: Great place for lunch at museum
data.text: The Winter Garden Café is a lovely space between the original museum and the addition, so one has the best of both worlds when eating there. It's bright and open, with tables placed far enough apart to give a sense of privacy. Fresh flowers grace each table. The menu of salads, soup, and sandwiches is varied and includes some healthy choices, all at reasonable prices. Muffins, cookies,  chips, coffee and tea are available, and there is a cooler of other beverages. Service is pleasant and efficient. I recommend it for all museum visitors.

data.title: Currier Museum Cafe
data.text: When visiting the Currier Museum, we stopped to eat lunch here. I ordered the half salad and soup combo which was perfect. They make everything fresh and the portions were hearty.

data.title: Beautiful spot, unique tasty food
data.text: This cafe is within the Currier Museum of Art. Even though it's indoors there's lots of natural light giving a feeling of dining on a patio. My hot ham and cheese sandwich was very good and the servers were friendly. Don't expect it to be fast, but it's great for a leisurely lunch.

data.title: short but good lunch menu; handled Gluten-free requirement well
data.text: Roast eggplant sandwich (not GF), salad (gf) and coffee were all very good. Nice setting in museum courtyard.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: Bright, clean restaurant. Ordered at counter and brought to table. Clean highchair. Wonderful views of inside of museum. Great art in this area in addition to the rest of the museum. I would eat here again if at the museum.

data.title: Good latte and minestrone soup
data.text: Needed a rest and a healthy snack while visiting the museum. The cafe proved to be sufficiently satisfying. I'll come back again.

data.title: Great cafe inside The Currier Art Museum
data.text:
Went to the museum on Saturday (Feb 1) as it participates in free museums if you have a Bank of America credit card.
For a Senior FREE admission is good!
We spent a few hours then stopped at the café which is set up in the atrium of the museum.
We were told the café is open to all without having to pay for museum admission.
Well the place is bright, free flowers on each table, spotless clean and the food and prices GREAT.
My wife and I split The flatbread pizza made with blue cheese, figs, onions, etc. that was the heartiest little pizza we have ever split.
Stop by if you are in the area (free parking at the museum).
